content:
StateBag Class

Definition

Manages the view state of ASP.NET server controls, including pages. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

public sealed class StateBag : System.Collections.IDictionary, System.Web.UI.IStateManager
Inheritance
System.Object
StateBag

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

View state for a page or control is the cumulative property values, or view, of that page or control. You can access this class through the ViewState property. Controls can also store essential state information in control state, but that information is not stored as a StateBag object.

This class is the primary storage mechanism for all HTML and Web server controls. It stores attribute/value pairs as strings associated with the control. It tracks changes to these attributes only after the OnInit method is executed for a page request, and saves the changes to the page's or control's view state.

This class implements a dictionary, and you can add items to it or remove items from it as you would any dictionary object. For more information about data collections, such as dictionaries, see Collections and Data Structures.

Constructors

StateBag()

Initializes a new instance of the StateBag class. This is the default constructor for this class.

public StateBag ();

StateBag(Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the StateBag class that allows stored state values to be case-insensitive.

public StateBag (bool ignoreCase);
ignoreCase
Boolean

true to ignore case; otherwise, false.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of StateItem objects in the StateBag object.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the StateBag.

Item(String)

Gets or sets the value of an item stored in the StateBag object.

public object this[string key] { get; set; }
key
String

The key for the item.

Value
System.Object

The specified item in the StateBag object.

Remarks

Using this member is the simplest way to save and retrieve view-state values for a control or a page.

If an item is not already stored in the StateBag object when you set this property, its key/value pair is added to the collection. If you set this property to null before the TrackViewState method is called on an item, it is removed from the StateBag object. Otherwise, when you set this property to null the key is saved to allow tracking of the item's view state.

Keys

Gets a collection of keys representing the items in the StateBag object.

public System.Collections.ICollection Keys { get; }
Value
ICollection

The collection of keys.

Remarks

These keys are the names of the control properties. For example, if you created a BGColor property on a Table control that you customized, a BGColor entry is created in this collection representing that property on your Table control.

These keys correspond to the names of the StateItem objects stored in the StateBag collection for the current page or server control.

You can iterate over this collection using the GetEnumerator method.

Values

Gets a collection of the view-state values stored in the StateBag object.

public System.Collections.ICollection Values { get; }
Value
ICollection

The collection of view-state values.

Remarks

This is a collection that contains the values for all the StateItem objects in the specified page or control. You can iterate through these values by using the GetEnumerator method.

Methods

Add(String,Object)

Adds a new StateItem object to the StateBag object. If the item already exists in the StateBag object, this method updates the value of the item.

public System.Web.UI.StateItem Add (string key, object value);
key
String

The attribute name for the StateItem.

value
System.Object

The value of the item to add to the StateBag.

Returns
StateItem

Returns a StateItem that represents the object added to view state.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

key is null.

- or -

The number of characters in key is 0.

Clear()

Removes all items from the current StateBag object.

public void Clear ();

GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that iterates over all the key/value pairs of the StateItem objects stored in the StateBag object.

public System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IDictionaryEnumerator

The enumerator to iterate through the state bag.

IsItemDirty(String)

Checks a StateItem object stored in the StateBag object to evaluate whether it has been modified since the call to stem.Web.UI.Control.TrackViewState*.

public bool IsItemDirty (string key);
key
String

The key of the item to check.

Returns
Boolean

true if the item has been modified; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method also returns false if the key parameter does not exist in the StateBag object.

Remove(String)

Removes the specified key/value pair from the StateBag object.

public void Remove (string key);
key
String

The item to remove.

SetDirty(Boolean)

Sets the state of the StateBag object as well as the stem.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection.Dirty* property of each of the StateItem objects contained by it.

public void SetDirty (bool dirty);
dirty
Boolean

true to mark the state of the collection and its items as modified; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The SetDirty method is used to force the collection and its contents to be serialized during a call to the System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState method.

SetItemDirty(String,Boolean)

Sets the stem.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection.Dirty* property for the specified StateItem object in the StateBag object.

public void SetItemDirty (string key, bool dirty);
key
String

The key that identifies which StateItem in the StateBag to set.

dirty
Boolean

true to mark the state of the item as modified; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The SetItemDirty method is used to prevent or force state management of specific properties, represented by StateItem objects in the StateBag collection.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from ICollection. The Array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

ICollection.IsSynchronized

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized*.

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

ICollection.SyncRoot

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot*.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

IDictionary.Add(Object,Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IDictionary.Add*.

void IDictionary.Add (object key, object value);
key
System.Object

The Object to use as the key of the element to add.

value
System.Object

The Object to use as the value of the element to add.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IDictionary interface.

IDictionary.Contains(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IDictionary.Contains*.

bool IDictionary.Contains (object key);
key
System.Object

The key to locate in the IDictionary object.

Returns
Boolean

true if the IDictionary contains an element with the key; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IDictionary interface.

IDictionary.IsFixedSize

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize*.

bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the IDictionary object has a fixed size; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IDictionary interface.

IDictionary.IsReadOnly

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly*.

bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the IDictionary object is read-only; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IDictionary interface.

IDictionary.Item(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IDictionary.Item*.

object System.Collections.IDictionary.Item[object key] { get; set; }
key
System.Object

The key of the element to get.

Returns
System.Object

The element with the specified key.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IDictionary interface.

IDictionary.Remove(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IDictionary.Remove*.

void IDictionary.Remove (object key);
key
System.Object

The key of the element to remove.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IDictionary interface.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator*.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the StateBag instance is cast to an IEnumerable interface.

IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

Gets a value indicating whether state changes are being tracked.

bool System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the StateBag is marked to save changes to its state; otherwise, false.

IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

Restores the previously saved view state of the StateBag object.

void IStateManager.LoadViewState (object state);
state
System.Object

An object that represents the StateBag state to restore.

Remarks

This method restores view-state information for the StateBag object from a previous page request that was saved by the System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState method.

This method is primarily used by control developers. You can override this method to control how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see ASP.NET State Management Overview.

IStateManager.SaveViewState()

Saves the changes to the StateBag object since the time the page was posted back to the server.

object IStateManager.SaveViewState ();
Returns
System.Object

The object that contains the changes to the view state of the StateBag. If there are no changes, or there are no StateItem elements in the StateBag, this method returns null.

Remarks

This method is primarily used by control developers.

View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties. These values are automatically placed in the server control's ViewState property, which is an instance of the StateBag class. This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle. For more information, see NIB: ASP.NET Web Server Controls.

When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML Hidden element. When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's ViewState property. For more information, see NIB: ASP.NET Web Server Controls and ASP.NET State Management Overview.

IStateManager.TrackViewState()

Causes the StateBag object to track changes to its state so that it can be persisted across requests.

void IStateManager.TrackViewState ();
